result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. George Alfred Robinson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant George Alfred Robinson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson appeared by video for George Alfred Robinson.  Attorney Careen Marie Gordon in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for preliminary hearing. Court took judicial notice of case 20CF2581. Preliminary hearing proceeded. Sworn for the State: MPD Police Officer B. Wright. State rests. Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Original information received and filed; defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Case is adjourned to Branch 41. Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant George Alfred Robinson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Dianne Margaret Erickson in court for George Alfred Robinson.  Attorney Katherine Seelow in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status of Counsel held.  Defense counsel was recently appointed and requests preliminary hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant George Alfred Robinson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Katherine Seelow appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  Tom Reed appeared on behalf of the Public Defenders Office.
Order to Show Cause Hearing held.  Discussions placed on the record.  Court will adjourn case to allow public defenders office additional time to appoint counsel.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Status conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Appointment Status Letter

Defendant George Alfred Robinson not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.
Hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Appointment Status Letter

Defendant George Alfred Robinson not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Appointment Status Letter

Defendant George Alfred Robinson not in court, defendant in custody. Student Intern Caroline Pellegrini with Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring for no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $10,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant George Alfred Robinson in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant George Alfred Robinson in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  George Alfred Robinson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DDR (10/22/2004)
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
